Name.label: Fatal mitochondrial disease due to combined oxidative phosphorylation defect type 3
Mitochondrial disorder due to a defect in mitochondrial protein synthesis

TextSection.Contents: Combined oxidative phosphorylation deficiency type 3 is an extremely rare clinically heterogenous disorder described in about 5 patients to date. Clinical signs included hypotonia, lactic acidosis, and hepatic insufficiency, with progressive encephalomyopathy or hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))

Synonym.label: Fatal mitochondrial disease due to COXPD3
